description:
The second season of Yuru Yuri continues following four girls who take over the former room of a tea ceremony club for their own amusement.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

title.native: ゆるゆり　なちゅやちゅみ！

node.description:
__Birthplace:__ Takaoka, Toyama Prefecture, Japan
__Residence:__ Kyoto, Kyoto Prefecture, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_namori_/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/124923) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/namoridane/)

Namori is a manga artist, best known for the manga [Yuru Yuri](https://anilist.co/manga/41593/Yuru-Yuri). She started attending painting classes around the age of 3 and she likes to work on her manga in coffee shops and other places outside. 

When she went to school, one of her classmates wrote "na" (the Hiragana "な") in a cute way, and Namori wanted to write it as well, hence her pen name starts with "na". The "mori" part does not stem from anywhere in particular.

__Height:__ 151 cm

[Profile (Link Plan)](http://link-plan.net/talent_taketatsu.html) | [Website](http://ayanataketatsu.jp) | [Website (Pony Canyon)](https://ayanataketatsu.jp/) | [Website (Fanclub)](https://ayanakoukoku.com/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/ayana_taketatsu/) | [(Old) Blog](https://ameblo.jp/strawberry-ayana/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ayana_take) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayachi_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/taketatsuofficial) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/27399.html) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayana_Taketatsu) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/竹達彩奈)

Attended Nihon Narration Engi Kenkyuujo before becoming affiliated with her first management company. She works for Link Plan and was formerly affiliated with I'm Enterprise and Assemble Heart. Because of her strong voice, she often voiced tsundere characters.

She is a member of the duo [Petit Milady](https://anilist.co/staff/116523/petit-milady) with fellow voice actress [Aoi Yuuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101686/Aoi-Yuuki).

She married voice actor [Yuuki Kaji](https://anilist.co/staff/95672/) on her 30th birthday in 2019. On June 30, 2022 she announced that she was expecting her first child with Kaji.

**Non-Anime Roles:**

- Anderson - Call of Duty: Black Ops II (VG)

He began playing classical piano at the age of 5 and learned other instruments from his experience playing with a brass band (flute) and rock band (drums). After graduating from the Nihon University College of Arts he worked as a composer at KOEI, working on the music for a number of their games. He left the company in 2006 and has since been composing for TV, anime, and movies.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/xexex36) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yoshihiro_watanabe1971/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/渡邊義弘_(アニメーター%29)

An animator, character designer and adult game artist.

_Not to be confused with the producer [of the same name.](https://anilist.co/staff/233840)_

[Profile (Aoni Pro)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/tsuda-minami.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minami_tsuda3)│[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minamimogumogu/)

She announced on June 8th, 2024 that she got married to fellow voice actor [Tatsumaru Tachibana](https://anilist.co/staff/137436/Tatsumaru-Tachibana).

__Current Residence:__ Tokyo, Japan
__Height:__ 150.3 cm
__Hobbies and Abilities:__ fashion, shopping, memorization
__Agency:__ 81 Produce

[Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=169) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rumirumi_81pro) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rumirumi_81/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/rumiokubo/) | [Web Diary](http://gree.jp/ookubo_rumi) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/30941.html) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/OkuboRumi927) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rumi_Okubo) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A4%A7%E4%B9%85%E4%BF%9D%E7%91%A0%E7%BE%8E)

She was discovered in 81 Produce's 3rd Seiyuu Audition in August, 2009, becoming one of the seven finalists amongst 1,109 who took initially part and won the excellence prize in the end. She made her debut in a minor role for the anime [Sasameki Koto](https://anilist.co/anime/6203).

(Source: AniDB)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Ami Aiba in "Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth" (VG)
- Arin in "Fairy Fencer F" (VG)
- Elizabeth Bathory in "Fate/Grand Order" (VG)
- Female Protagonist in "Digimonstory Cybersleuth" (VG)
- Isto in "ToHeart2 Dungeon Travelers 2" (VG)
- Lancer in "Fate/Extra CCC" (VG)
- Little Red Riding Hood in "Kongokutou Mary Skelter" (VG)
- Lunalu in "Granlue Fantasy" (VG)
- Mayuka Morimoto in "Chou Ginga Sendan -Infinity-" (VG)
- Misaki Shinoyama in "Star Horse Pocket" (VG)
- Rider (Astolfo) in "Fate/Grand Order" (VG)
- Tia in "Goddess of Victory: Nikke" (VG)

[Profile](http://earlywing.co.jp/talent_w/otsuboyuka.php) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/00tsubo_yuka) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/43ZsqoTPYf5cc4ae3KPVuU?autoplay=true)

Yuka Ootsubo is a Japanese voice actress and singer affiliated with Early Wing. In 2014, she started her career as a singer by joining the band SmileY inc. with Vocaloid musician Yuuyu-P. She also did the voice of Vocaloid character Azuki Masaoka for V4.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Kaalaa Baunaa - Reverse 1999 (VG)
